questions.question: The purse was …………………………. to the owner.
questions.description: To hand something over to somebody is to give it to them.

questions.question: My friend is going to ……………………….. a new firm.
questions.description: To set up is to establish.

questions.question: The rebellion was ………………………….. by the army.
questions.description: To put something down is to suppress it.

questions.question: The chief guest has not ………………………….. yet although it is time for the meeting to start.
questions.description: To turn up is to arrive.

questions.question: It …………………………. that he was a spy.
questions.description: Turn out can mean to be discovered to be something

questions.question: The miser …………………………. a cry when he learnt that his money was lost.
questions.description: Let out can mean make a noise.

questions.question: How did he …………………………….. so much wealth?
questions.description: To come by wealth is to acquire it.

questions.question: I couldn’t …………………………. what he was saying.
questions.description: To make out is to understand.

questions.question: The doctor advised him to ………………………………… smoking.
questions.description: To give up smoking is to quit smoking.

questions.question: His application was …………………………..
questions.description: To turn down application is to reject it.
